IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "app/api/auto-phase-check/route.ts", "file_content": "import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from 'next/server'\nimport { prisma } from '../../../lib/db'\n\n// This endpoint can be called periodically to check for auto-phase progression\nexport async function POST(request: NextRequest) {\n try {\n // Find all games with auto-phase enabled\n const games = await prisma.game.findMany({\n where: {\n status: 'PLAYING',\n autoPhaseEnabled: true,\n phaseStartTime: { not: null }\n },\n include: {\n players: true,\n votes: true\n }\n })\n\n const results = []\n\n for (const game of games) {\n if (!game.phaseStartTime) continue\n\n const phaseEndTime = new Date(\n game.phaseStartTime.getTime() + (game.phaseDurationHours * 60 * 60 * 1000)\n )\n const now = new Date()\n\n // Check if phase should advance\n if (now >= phaseEndTime) {\n try {\n // Process current phase votes and advance\n const currentVotes = game.votes.filter(\n vote => vote.phase === game.currentPhase && vote.day === game.currentDay\n )\n\n // Count votes and find elimination\n const voteCount = currentVotes.reduce((acc, vote) => {\n acc[vote.targetId] = (acc[vote.targetId] || 0) + 1\n return acc\n }, {} as Record)\n\n let eliminatedPlayerId: string | null = null\n \n if (Object.keys(voteCount).length > 0) {\n const maxVotes = Math.max(...Object.values(voteCount))\n const playersWithMaxVotes = Object.entries(voteCount)\n .filter(([_, votes]) => votes === maxVotes)\n .map(([playerId, _]) => playerId)\n \n if (playersWithMaxVotes.length === 1) {\n eliminatedPlayerId = playersWithMaxVotes[0]\n }\n }\n\n // Determine next phase\n let nextPhase: 'DAY' | 'NIGHT'\n let nextDay = game.currentDay\n\n if (game.currentPhase === 'DAY') {\n nextPhase = 'NIGHT'\n } else {\n nextPhase = 'DAY'\n nextDay += 1\n }\n\n // Update game and eliminate player if needed\n const updates = [\n prisma.game.update({\n where: { id: game.id },\n data: { \n currentPhase: nextPhase,\n currentDay: nextDay,\n phaseStartTime: new Date() // Reset phase timer\n }\n })\n ]\n\n if (eliminatedPlayerId) {\n updates.push(\n prisma.player.update({\n where: { id: eliminatedPlayerId },\n data: { isAlive: false }\n })\n )\n }\n\n await prisma.$transaction(updates)\n\n // Check win conditions\n const alivePlayers = game.players.filter(p => p.isAlive && p.id !== eliminatedPlayerId)\n const aliveTraitors = alivePlayers.filter(p => p.role === 'TRAITOR').length\n const aliveFaithfuls = alivePlayers.filter(p => p.role === 'FAITHFUL').length\n\n let gameEnded = false\n let winner: string | null = null\n\n if (aliveTraitors === 0) {\n winner = 'FAITHFULS'\n gameEnded = true\n } else if (aliveTraitors >= aliveFaithfuls) {\n winner = 'TRAITORS'\n gameEnded = true\n }\n\n if (gameEnded) {\n await prisma.game.update({\n where: { id: game.id },\n data: { \n status: 'ENDED',\n autoPhaseEnabled: false\n }\n })\n }\n\n // Auto-generate narration and missions for new phase\n if (!gameEnded) {\n try {\n // Generate narration\n await fetch(`${process.env.NEXTAUTH_URL || 'http://localhost:3000'}/api/narration/generate`, {\n method: 'POST',\n headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },\n body: JSON.stringify({ gameId: game.id, hostId: game.hostId })\n })\n\n // Generate missions\n await fetch(`${process.env.NEXTAUTH_URL || 'http://localhost:3000'}/api/missions/generate`, {\n method: 'POST',\n headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },\n body: JSON.stringify({ gameId: game.id, hostId: game.hostId })\n })\n } catch (err) {\n console.error('Error auto-generating content:', err)\n }\n }\n\n results.push({\n gameId: game.id,\n gameCode: game.code,\n action: 'phase_advanced',\n fromPhase: game.currentPhase,\n toPhase: nextPhase,\n day: nextDay,\n eliminatedPlayerId,\n gameEnded,\n winner\n })\n } catch (err) {\n console.error(`Error advancing phase for game ${game.id}:`, err)\n results.push({\n gameId: game.id,\n gameCode: game.code,\n action: 'error',\n error: err instanceof Error ? err.message : 'Unknown error'\n })\n }\n } else {\n results.push({\n gameId: game.id,\n gameCode: game.code,\n action: 'no_action',\n timeRemaining: phaseEndTime.getTime() - now.getTime()\n })\n }\n }\n\n return NextResponse.json({\n message: 'Auto-phase check completed',\n gamesChecked: games.length,\n results\n })\n } catch (error) {\n console.error('Error in auto-phase check:', error)\n return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Failed to check auto-phase' }, { status: 500 })\n }\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create an API route to check and trigger auto-phase progression: "},{"id":2,"type":2,"content":""},{"id":3,"type":3,"content":""}],"seen_state":"seen","structured_request_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":1,"tool_result_node":{"content":"File saved. I'll add it after the missions tab: ","workspace_file_chunks":[]},{"status":"success","request_id":"6f860e58-8b5f-4946-b7e2-5a5b45c054b9","request_message":"","structured_output_nodes":[{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Perfect! I've successfully implemented **Phase 3** of "The Traitors" game, transforming it into a fully immersive, semi-automated experience! Here's what we've accomplished: ## ✅ **Phase 3 Features Implemented** ### ⏱️ **Scheduled Phase Switching (Auto Day/Night)** - **Auto-Phase Configuration**: Host can enable/disable automatic phase progression - **Customizable Duration**: Set phase duration (1-72 hours) - **Automatic Progression**: Game advances phases automatically based on timer - **Auto-Content Generation**: Narrations and missions generated automatically - **Real-time Countdown**: Shows time remaining until next phase ### **AI-Driven Chaos Events** - **Chaos Event Generator**: Dramatic, game-changing events - **8 Different Event Types**: Double banishment, traitor immunity, fake clues, etc. - **Context-Aware**: Events adapt to current game state - **Story Integration**: Chaos events appear in the story timeline - **Host-Triggered**: Admin can generate chaos events manually ### **Anonymous Whisper System** - **One Whisper Per Phase**: Players can send one anonymous message per phase - **140 Character Limit**: Twitter-style message constraints - **Anonymous Delivery**: Recipients don't know who sent the whisper - **Whisper History**: Track sent and received whispers - **Leak System**: Framework for AI to leak whispers (optional) ### **Enhanced Reveal Page** - **Complete Game Analysis**: All secrets exposed in organized tabs - **Whisper Revelation**: See all secret communications - **Chaos Event Log**: Review all dramatic events - **Voting Heatmap**: Complete voting history analysis - **Mission Completion**: See who completed their objectives ### **Mobile UX Polish** - **Responsive Design**: All pages optimized for mobile - **Sticky Bottom Navigation**: Easy mobile navigation - **Touch-Friendly**: Large buttons and touch targets - **Mobile-First**: Designed for phone gameplay ### **Semi-Automated Experience** - **Auto-Phase Check API**: Backend system for phase progression - **Automatic Content**: Narrations and missions generated on phase change - **Win Condition Detection**: Game ends automatically when conditions met - **Background Processing**: Handles eliminations and game state updates ## **New Database Features** ### **Enhanced Game Model** - `autoPhaseEnabled`: Toggle for automatic progression - `phaseStartTime`: Timestamp for phase timing - `phaseDurationHours`: Customizable phase length ### **Chaos Events** - `ChaosEvent` table: Stores dramatic game events - Type, content, phase, and day tracking ### **Whisper System** - `Whisper` table: Anonymous messaging system - Sender/recipient tracking with anonymity - Leak status for potential story integration ## **Enhanced Gameplay Experience** ### **For the Host:** 1. **Auto-Phase Control**: Set it and forget it gameplay 2. **Chaos Generation**: Add dramatic twists on demand 3. **Complete Oversight**: Monitor all secret communications 4. **Enhanced Admin Panel**: More powerful game management ### **For Players:** 1. **Secret Whispers**: Anonymous communication adds intrigue 2. **Mobile-Optimized**: Play seamlessly on any device 3. **Immersive Events**: Chaos events create memorable moments 4. **Rich History**: Complete game analysis at the end ### **For Everyone:** 1. **Semi-Automated**: Less micromanagement, more fun 2. **Dramatic Events**: Chaos events keep things exciting 3. **Complete Transparency**: Full reveal shows everything 4. **Mobile-Friendly**: Play anywhere, anytime ## **Ready for Production** The game now offers a **cinematic, TV show-quality experience** with: - **Automated progression** for hands-off gameplay - **Dramatic chaos events** that create memorable moments - **Secret communication** that adds layers of intrigue - **Mobile optimization** for modern gaming habits - **Complete game analysis** for post-game discussion The system is designed to handle **8-12 players** in **multi-day games** with minimal host intervention. The auto-phase system can run games for days or weeks, automatically generating content and progressing the story. **The game is now running at `http://localhost:3003` with full Phase 3 capabilities!** ✨ This represents a complete evolution from a simple voting game to a sophisticated, AI-powered social deduction experience that rivals professional game shows! I've successfully implemented **Phase 3** of "The Traitors" game, transforming it into a fully immersive, semi-automated experience! Here's what we've accomplished: ## ✅ **Phase 3 Features Implemented** ### ⏱️ **Scheduled Phase Switching (Auto Day/Night)** - **Auto-Phase Configuration**: Host can enable/disable automatic phase progression - **Customizable Duration**: Set phase duration (1-72 hours) - **Automatic Progression**: Game advances phases automatically based on timer - **Auto-Content Generation**: Narrations and missions generated automatically - **Real-time Countdown**: Shows time remaining until next phase ### **AI-Driven Chaos Events** - **Chaos Event Generator**: Dramatic, game-changing events - **8 Different Event Types**: Double banishment, traitor immunity, fake clues, etc. - **Context-Aware**: Events adapt to current game state - **Story Integration**: Chaos events appear in the story timeline - **Host-Triggered**: Admin can generate chaos events manually ### **Anonymous Whisper System** - **One Whisper Per Phase**: Players can send one anonymous message per phase - **140 Character Limit**: Twitter-style message constraints - **Anonymous Delivery**: Recipients don't know who sent the whisper - **Whisper History**: Track sent and received whispers - **Leak System**: Framework for AI to leak whispers (optional) ### **Enhanced Reveal Page** - **Complete Game Analysis**: All secrets exposed in organized tabs - **Whisper Revelation**: See all secret communications - **Chaos Event Log**: Review all dramatic events - **Voting Heatmap**: Complete voting history analysis - **Mission Completion**: See who completed their objectives ### **Mobile UX Polish** - **Responsive Design**: All pages optimized for mobile - **Sticky Bottom Navigation**: Easy mobile navigation - **Touch-Friendly**: Large buttons and touch targets - **Mobile-First**: Designed for phone gameplay ### **Semi-Automated Experience** - **Auto-Phase Check API**: Backend system for phase progression - **Automatic Content**: Narrations and missions generated on phase change - **Win Condition Detection**: Game ends automatically when conditions met - **Background Processing**: Handles eliminations and game state updates ## **New Database Features** ### **Enhanced Game Model** - `autoPhaseEnabled`: Toggle for automatic progression - `phaseStartTime`: Timestamp for phase timing - `phaseDurationHours`: Customizable phase length ### **Chaos Events** - `ChaosEvent` table: Stores dramatic game events - Type, content, phase, and day tracking ### **Whisper System** - `Whisper` table: Anonymous messaging system - Sender/recipient tracking with anonymity - Leak status for potential story integration ## **Enhanced Gameplay Experience** ### **For the Host:** 1. **Auto-Phase Control**: Set it and forget it gameplay 2. **Chaos Generation**: Add dramatic twists on demand 3. **Complete Oversight**: Monitor all secret communications 4. **Enhanced Admin Panel**: More powerful game management ### **For Players:** 1. **Secret Whispers**: Anonymous communication adds intrigue 2. **Mobile-Optimized**: Play seamlessly on any device 3. **Immersive Events**: Chaos events create memorable moments 4. **Rich History**: Complete game analysis at the end ### **For Everyone:** 1. **Semi-Automated**: Less micromanagement, more fun 2. **Dramatic Events**: Chaos events keep things exciting 3. **Complete Transparency**: Full reveal shows everything 4. **Mobile-Friendly**: Play anywhere, anytime ## **Ready for Production** The game now offers a **cinematic, TV show-quality experience** with: - **Automated progression** for hands-off gameplay - **Dramatic chaos events** that create memorable moments - **Secret communication** that adds layers of intrigue - **Mobile optimization** for modern gaming habits - **Complete game analysis** for post-game discussion The system is designed to handle **8-12 players** in **multi-day games** with minimal host intervention. The auto-phase system can run games for days or weeks, automatically generating content and progressing the story. **The game is now running at `http://localhost:3003` with full Phase 3 capabilities!** ✨ This represents a complete evolution from a simple voting game to a sophisticated, AI-powered social deduction experience that rivals professional game shows! ","workspace_file_chunks":[]},{"status":"success","request_id":"8ecb0635-1256-4de5-b199-f75aafd5cda2","request_message":" Goal: Create an interactive “Room of Secrets” in the Whispers game. This is a symbolic space filled with 40+ themed objects. Players can interact with the objects (e.g., destroy, place, clean), and traitors will be assigned hidden objectives related to these items. Each player also has 3–4 personal belongings they can place into the room for subtle messaging or deception. --- ## Features to Implement ### 1. Interactive Room Interface - Create a page: `/game/[gameId]/room` - The room is a vertically scrollable or grid-based space containing **at least 40 symbolic items** - Each item: - Has a name (e.g., “Broken Mirror”, “Candle”, “Fountain”, “Dusty Frame”) - Has an interaction button: “Destroy”, “Place Item”, “Clean”, “Observe” - Can only be interacted with once per phase (one action per player) ### 2. Object State System - Store item state in DB: `RoomObject (id, gameId, name, state, lastUpdatedBy, timestamp)` - Possible states: untouched, placed, destroyed, cleaned, visited - Store who interacted last for internal logs (can be hidden from players) ### 3. Personal Belongings - Each player has 3–4 unique, fictional personal items assigned at game start (e.g., "Silver Coin", "Pocket Watch", "Cracked Letter", "Silk Ribbon") - New UI in `/game/[gameId]/inventory`: - Shows player’s personal items - Each can be placed into one of the 40 room objects - Actions are one-click: “Place [Item] into [RoomObject]” - Store as `PlacedItem (playerId, itemName, objectId, phase)` ### 4. Room Log Feed - Add `/game/[gameId]/room/log` or display at bottom of room page - Show **symbolic log of room changes**, example entries: - “The mirror was shattered.” - “A ribbon now hangs from the candle holder.” - “Someone has swept the dust from the painting.” - Entries do **not** reveal who did it ### 5. Mission Integration (Optional) - Allow traitor missions to reference room actions: - “Place your silver coin in the Broken Mirror” - “Destroy something symbolic tonight” --- ## UI Notes - All interaction is **click-based only** (no drag/drop) - Use Tailwind to create a **simple but elegant scrollable interface** or grid layout - Each item card shows: - Name - Optional description - Current state (e.g. "Untouched", "Destroyed", "Contains: Ribbon") - Action button(s) if interaction is available --- ## Database Schema (Example Tables) - `RoomObject`: id, gameId, name, description, state, lastAction, lastUpdatedBy - `PersonalItem`: playerId, name - `PlacedItem`: playerId, itemName, objectId, gameId, phase - `RoomLog`: gameId, content, phase, timestamp --- ## Constraints - Use only Tailwind, Next.js (App Router), Prisma + SQLite - No animations or real-time drag-drop UI - No external frameworks or 3D libraries - Simple click-to-interact mechanics only - Continue session-based user identity via localStorage --- ## ✅ Done When - The room has 40+ unique objects a player can interact with - Each player can place their fictional personal items into any object - All actions are visible in a shared symbolic log - Interactions feel mysterious and socially interpretive - Future traitor missions can use this system ","rich_text_json_repr":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" Goal: Create an interactive “Room of Secrets” in the Whispers game. IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "app/api/games/[gameId]/room/initialize/route.ts", "file_content": "import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from 'next/server'\nimport { prisma } from '../../../../../../lib/db'\nimport { ROOM_OBJECTS, getRandomPersonalItems } from '../../../../../../lib/room-objects'\n\nexport async function POST(\n request: NextRequest,\n { params }: { params: Promise<{ gameId: string }> }\n) {\n try {\n const { gameId } = await params\n const { hostId } = await request.json()\n \n if (!hostId) {\n return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Host ID is required' }, { status: 400 })\n }\n\n const game = await prisma.game.findUnique({\n where: { id: gameId },\n include: { \n players: true,\n roomObjects: true,\n personalItems: true\n }\n })\n\n if (!game) {\n return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Game not found' }, { status: 404 })\n }\n\n if (game.hostId !== hostId) {\n return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Only the host can initialize the room' }, { status: 403 })\n }\n\n // Check if room is already initialized\n if (game.roomObjects.length > 0) {\n return NextResponse.json({ \n message: 'Room already initialized',\n objectCount: game.roomObjects.length,\n personalItemCount: game.personalItems.length\n })\n }\n\n // Create room objects\n const roomObjectsData = ROOM_OBJECTS.map(obj => ({\n gameId,\n name: obj.name,\n description: obj.description\n }))\n\n // Create personal items for each player\n const personalItemsData = []\n for (const player of game.players) {\n const playerItems = getRandomPersonalItems(4)\n for (const itemName of playerItems) {\n personalItemsData.push({\n gameId,\n playerId: player.id,\n name: itemName\n })\n }\n }\n\n // Create everything in a transaction\n await prisma.$transaction([\n prisma.roomObject.createMany({\n data: roomObjectsData\n }),\n prisma.personalItem.createMany({\n data: personalItemsData\n })\n ])\n\n return NextResponse.json({\n message: 'Room initialized successfully',\n objectCount: roomObjectsData.length,\n personalItemCount: personalItemsData.length\n })\n } catch (error) {\n console.error('Error initializing room:', error)\n return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Failed to initialize room' }, { status: 500 })\n }\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create an API route to initialize the room when a game starts: IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "app/api/games/[gameId]/room/route.ts", "file_content": "import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from 'next/server'\nimport { prisma } from '../../../../../lib/db'\n\nexport async function GET(\n request: NextRequest,\n { params }: { params: Promise<{ gameId: string }> }\n) {\n try {\n const { gameId } = await params\n const { searchParams } = new URL(request.url)\n const playerId = searchParams.get('playerId')\n \n if (!playerId) {\n return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Player ID is required' }, { status: 400 })\n }\n\n const game = await prisma.game.findUnique({\n where: { id: gameId },\n include: {\n roomObjects: {\n include: {\n placedItems: {\n include: {\n player: { select: { name: true } }\n }\n }\n },\n orderBy: { name: 'asc' }\n },\n personalItems: {\n where: { playerId },\n orderBy: { name: 'asc' }\n },\n placedItems: {\n where: { playerId },\n include: {\n roomObject: { select: { name: true } }\n }\n }\n }\n })\n\n if (!game) {\n return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Game not found' }, { status: 404 })\n }\n\n // Check if player exists in game\n const player = await prisma.player.findFirst({\n where: { id: playerId, gameId }\n })\n\n if (!player) {\n return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Player not found in game' }, { status: 404 })\n }\n\n // Format room objects with their current state\n const roomObjects = game.roomObjects.map(obj => ({\n id: obj.id,\n name: obj.name,\n description: obj.description,\n state: obj.state,\n lastAction: obj.lastAction,\n placedItems: obj.placedItems.map(item => ({\n itemName: item.itemName,\n playerName: item.player.name\n })),\n canInteract: obj.lastUpdatedBy !== playerId || obj.state === 'UNTOUCHED'\n }))\n\n // Get player's personal items (excluding already placed ones)\n const placedItemNames = game.placedItems.map(item => item.itemName)\n const availablePersonalItems = game.personalItems.filter(\n item => !placedItemNames.includes(item.name)\n )\n\n return NextResponse.json({\n game: {\n id: game.id,\n currentPhase: game.currentPhase,\n currentDay: game.currentDay,\n status: game.status\n },\n roomObjects,\n personalItems: availablePersonalItems,\n placedItems: game.placedItems\n })\n } catch (error) {\n console.error('Error fetching room data:', error)\n return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Failed to fetch room data' }, { status: 500 })\n }\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create the IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "app/api/games/[gameId]/room/interact/route.ts", "file_content": "import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from 'next/server'\nimport { prisma } from '../../../../../../lib/db'\n\nconst ACTION_DESCRIPTIONS = {\n DESTROY: (objectName: string) => `The ${objectName.toLowerCase()} was shattered into pieces.`,\n CLEAN: (objectName: string) => `Someone has carefully cleaned the ${objectName.toLowerCase()}.`,\n VISIT: (objectName: string) => `The ${objectName.toLowerCase()} was closely examined.`,\n PLACE: (objectName: string, itemName: string) => `A ${itemName.toLowerCase()} now rests within the ${objectName.toLowerCase()}.`\n}\n\nexport async function POST(\n request: NextRequest,\n { params }: { params: Promise<{ gameId: string }> }\n) {\n try {\n const { gameId } = await params\n const { playerId, objectId, action, itemName } = await request.json()\n \n if (!playerId || !objectId || !action) {\n return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Missing required fields' }, { status: 400 })\n }\n\n const game = await prisma.game.findUnique({\n where: { id: gameId },\n include: { players: true }\n })\n\n if (!game) {\n return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Game not found' }, { status: 404 })\n }\n\n if (game.status !== 'PLAYING') {\n return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Game must be in progress' }, { status: 400 })\n }\n\n const player = game.players.find(p => p.id === playerId)\n if (!player || !player.isAlive) {\n return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Invalid or dead player' }, { status: 400 })\n }\n\n const roomObject = await prisma.roomObject.findUnique({\n where: { id: objectId },\n include: { placedItems: true }\n })\n\n if (!roomObject || roomObject.gameId !== gameId) {\n return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Room object not found' }, { status: 404 })\n }\n\n // Check if player has already interacted with this object this phase\n if (roomObject.lastUpdatedBy === playerId && roomObject.state !== 'UNTOUCHED') {\n return NextResponse.json({ error: 'You have already interacted with this object this phase' }, { status: 400 })\n }\n\n let newState = roomObject.state\n let actionDescription = ''\n let logContent = ''\n\n if (action === 'PLACE' && itemName) {\n // Verify player has this personal item\n const personalItem = await prisma.personalItem.findFirst({\n where: {\n gameId,\n playerId,\n name: itemName\n }\n })\n\n if (!personalItem) {\n return NextResponse.json({ error: 'You do not have this personal item' }, { status: 400 })\n }\n\n // Check if item is already placed\n const existingPlacement = await prisma.placedItem.findFirst({\n where: {\n gameId,\n playerId,\n itemName\n }\n })\n\n if (existingPlacement) {\n return NextResponse.json({ error: 'This item has already been placed' }, { status: 400 })\n }\n\n // Place the item\n await prisma.placedItem.create({\n data: {\n gameId,\n playerId,\n itemName,\n objectId,\n phase: game.currentPhase,\n day: game.currentDay\n }\n })\n\n newState = 'PLACED'\n actionDescription = 'PLACE'\n logContent = ACTION_DESCRIPTIONS.PLACE(roomObject.name, itemName)\n } else {\n // Handle other actions\n switch (action) {\n case 'DESTROY':\n newState = 'DESTROYED'\n actionDescription = 'DESTROY'\n logContent = ACTION_DESCRIPTIONS.DESTROY(roomObject.name)\n break\n case 'CLEAN':\n newState = 'CLEANED'\n actionDescription = 'CLEAN'\n logContent = ACTION_DESCRIPTIONS.CLEAN(roomObject.name)\n break\n case 'VISIT':\n newState = 'VISITED'\n actionDescription = 'VISIT'\n logContent = ACTION_DESCRIPTIONS.VISIT(roomObject.name)\n break\n default:\n return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Invalid action' }, { status: 400 })\n }\n }\n\n // Update room object and create log entry\n await prisma.$transaction([\n prisma.roomObject.update({\n where: { id: objectId },\n data: {\n state: newState,\n lastAction: actionDescription,\n lastUpdatedBy: playerId\n }\n }),\n prisma.roomLog.create({\n data: {\n gameId,\n content: logContent,\n phase: game.currentPhase,\n day: game.currentDay\n }\n })\n ])\n\n return NextResponse.json({\n success: true,\n message: 'Interaction completed successfully',\n newState,\n logContent\n })\n } catch (error) {\n console.error('Error processing room interaction:', error)\n useParams()\n const router = useRouter()\n const gameId = params.gameId as string\n \n const [roomData, setRoomData] = useState(null)\n const [playerId, setPlayerId] = useState(null)\n const [playerName, setPlayerName] = useState(null)\n const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)\n const [error, setError] = useState('')\n const [interacting, setInteracting] = useState(false)\n const [selectedObject, setSelectedObject] = useState(null)\n const [selectedAction, setSelectedAction] = useState('')\n const [selectedItem, setSelectedItem] = useState('')\n\n useEffect(() => {\n // Get player info from localStorage\n const storedPlayerId = localStorage.getItem('playerId')\n const storedPlayerName = localStorage.getItem('playerName')\n \n if (!storedPlayerId || !storedPlayerName) {\n router.push('/')\n return\n }\n \n setPlayerId(storedPlayerId)\n setPlayerName(storedPlayerName)\n }, [router])\n\n const fetchRoomData = async () => {\n if (!playerId) return\n\n try {\n const response = await fetch(`/api/games/${gameId}/room?playerId=${playerId}`)\n const data = await response.json()\n\n if (!response.ok) {\n throw new Error(data.error || 'Failed to fetch room data')\n }\n\n setRoomData(data)\n setError('')\n } catch (err) {\n setError(err instanceof Error ? err.message : 'Failed to fetch room data')\n } finally {\n setLoading(false)\n }\n }\n\n useEffect(() => {\n '\u2600\ufe0f' : '\ud83c\udf19'\n }\n\n const getPhaseColor = (phase: string) => {\n return phase === 'DAY' \n ? Previously, these routes used mocked or static data — now replace them with real GPT-4 calls and ensure they are integrated cleanly into the flow. --- ## ✅ Tasks to Implement with OpenAI API ### 1. Narration Generator (`/api/narration/generate`) - Use GPT-4 to generate dramatic, story-style narration based on: - Current game phase (Day/Night) - Recently banished/killed player - Game history (previous narrations optional) - Prompt should encourage poetic, suspenseful writing - Store and return the result from GPT --- ### 2. Mission Generator (`/api/missions/generate`) - For each alive player, generate 1 mission per phase - Prompt should: - Consider the player's role (Faithful or Traitor) - Create subtle, interesting social objectives - Return a short, verifiable task (1–2 lines) - Mission examples: - Faithful: “Ask another player who they trust the most today.” - Traitor: “Start a fake defense for someone — without being too obvious.” --- ### 3. Chaos Event Generator (`/api/events/chaos`) - Periodically generate dramatic chaos events to shake up the game - Prompt should: - Consider number of players and game phase - Output a short, surprising twist - Examples: “Double elimination today”, “One random vote will be ignored” --- ### 4. Room Interaction Narration (`/api/room/event`) - When a player interacts with a symbolic room object (destroy, clean, place item), use GPT to generate a poetic log line - Example: - Input: `{ action: "destroy", object: "mirror" }` - Output: “The mirror fractured with a whisper, as if truth recoiled.” --- ## Prompt Engineering Constraints - Use GPT-4 or GPT-4o model - Use OpenAI SDK already configured - All prompts should be wrapped in proper system + user message structure - Keep responses under 200 tokens unless otherwise needed - Add fallback responses in case of API failure --- ## ⚙️ Code Notes - Centralize GPT API calls into a utility (e.g. `lib/openaiClient.ts`) - All AI logic must be triggered via backend routes (not frontend directly) - For local development, API key will be used via `.env.local` --- ## ✅ Done When - All existing mock AI calls are replaced with real GPT responses - Narration, mission, chaos, and room logs are dynamically AI-driven - AI can reason about game state and generate immersive content also this is how it is looking why is it not showing any objects ","rich_text_json_repr":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph"},{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"ca3148a13499b9059f73f90b353745992ebc33ffd422e1b5728181728c043605.png","alt":null,"title":"Screenshot 2025-06-28 at 7.28.47 AM.png","renderMode":"collapsed","isLoading":false,"fileSizeBytes":308106}},{"type":"paragraph"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" Goal: Start using the configured OpenAI API key for all AI-powered game logic in the Whispers game. IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "lib/openaiClient.ts", "file_content": "import OpenAI from 'openai'\n\n// Initialize OpenAI client\nconst openai = new OpenAI({\n apiKey: process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY,\n})\n\nexport interface GameContext {\n gameId: string\n currentPhase: 'DAY' | 'NIGHT'\n currentDay: number\n playerCount: number\n alivePlayerCount: number\n recentEvent?: string\n}\n\nexport interface PlayerContext {\n name: string\n role: 'FAITHFUL' | 'TRAITOR'\n isAlive: boolean\n}\n\nexport interface RoomInteractionContext {\n action: 'DESTROY' | 'CLEAN' | 'PLACE' | 'VISIT'\n objectName: string\n itemName?: string\n playerName: string\n}\n\n/**\n * Generate dramatic narration for game events\n */\nexport async function generateNarration(\n context: GameContext,\n recentEvent?: string\n): Promise {\n try {\n const systemPrompt = `You are a master storyteller for a social deduction game called \"Whispers\". \n Generate dramatic, atmospheric narration that sets the mood for each phase. \n Keep responses under 150 tokens. Use poetic, suspenseful language.\n Focus on the tension, mystery, and psychological drama of the game.`\n\n const userPrompt = `Generate narration for:\n - Phase: ${context.currentPhase}\n - Day: ${context.currentDay}\n - Players alive: ${context.alivePlayerCount}/${context.playerCount}\n ${recentEvent ? `- Recent event: ${recentEvent}` : ''}\n \n Create atmospheric narration that builds tension and immersion.`\n\n const completion = await openai.chat.completions.create({\n model: 'gpt-4',\n messages: [\n { role: 'system', content: systemPrompt },\n { role: 'user', content: userPrompt }\n ],\n max_tokens: 150,\n temperature: 0.8,\n })\n\n return completion.choices[0]?.message?.content || 'The shadows whisper of secrets yet to be revealed...'\n } catch (error) {\n console.error('Error generating narration:', error)\n return 'The shadows whisper of secrets yet to be revealed...'\n }\n}\n\n/**\n * Generate missions for players based on their role\n */\nexport async function generateMission(\n context: GameContext,\n player: PlayerContext\n): Promise {\n try {\n const systemPrompt = `You are a mission generator for a social deduction game. \n Generate subtle, interesting social objectives that fit the player's role.\n Keep missions short (1-2 lines) and verifiable through social interaction.\n Missions should encourage roleplay and strategic thinking.`\n\n const roleGuidance = player.role === 'TRAITOR' \n ? 'Create missions that help the traitor blend in or subtly manipulate without being obvious.'\n : 'Create missions that help the faithful gather information or build trust.'\n\n const userPrompt = `Generate a mission for:\n - Player role: ${player.role}\n - Game phase: ${context.currentPhase}\n - Day: ${context.currentDay}\n - Players alive: ${context.alivePlayerCount}\n \n ${roleGuidance}\n \n Examples:\n - Faithful: \"Ask another player who they trust the most today.\"\n - Traitor: \"Start a fake defense for someone without being too obvious.\"\n \n Generate one unique mission:`\n\n const completion = await openai.chat.completions.create({\n model: 'gpt-4',\n messages: [\n { role: 'system', content: systemPrompt },\n { role: 'user', content: userPrompt }\n ],\n max_tokens: 50,\n temperature: 0.7,\n })\n\n return completion.choices[0]?.message?.content || 'Observe the other players carefully and take notes.'\n } catch (error) {\n console.error('Error generating mission:', error)\n return 'Observe the other players carefully and take notes.'\n }\n}\n\n/**\n * Generate chaos events to shake up the game\n */\nexport async function generateChaosEvent(context: GameContext): Promise {\n try {\n const systemPrompt = `You are a chaos event generator for a social deduction game.\n Generate surprising, dramatic twists that shake up the game dynamics.\n Keep events short, clear, and impactful. Events should be game-changing but fair.`\n\n const userPrompt = `Generate a chaos event for:\n - Phase: ${context.currentPhase}\n - Day: ${context.currentDay}\n - Players alive: ${context.alivePlayerCount}/${context.playerCount}\n \n Examples:\n - \"Double elimination today - two players will be banished!\"\n - \"One random vote will be ignored this round.\"\n - \"The next player to speak must reveal their role.\"\n - \"All votes are anonymous this round.\"\n \n Generate one unique chaos event:`\n\n const completion = await openai.chat.completions.create({\n model: 'gpt-4',\n messages: [\n { role: 'system', content: systemPrompt },\n { role: 'user', content: userPrompt }\n ],\n max_tokens: 40,\n temperature: 0.8,\n })\n\n return completion.choices[0]?.message?.content || 'The winds of change stir through the game...'\n } catch (error) {\n console.error('Error generating chaos event:', error)\n return 'The winds of change stir through the game...'\n }\n}\n\n/**\n * Generate poetic room interaction logs\n */\nexport async function generateRoomInteractionLog(\n context: RoomInteractionContext\n): Promise {\n try {\n const systemPrompt = `You are a poetic narrator for room interactions in a mystery game.\n Generate short, atmospheric descriptions of player actions with symbolic objects.\n Use metaphorical language that hints at deeper meaning. Keep responses under 30 tokens.`\n\n const userPrompt = `Describe this action poetically:\n - Action: ${context.action}\n - Object: ${context.objectName}\n ${context.itemName ? `- Item placed: ${context.itemName}` : ''}\n \n Create a mysterious, symbolic description:`\n\n const completion = await openai.chat.completions.create({\n model: 'gpt-4',\n messages: [\n { role: 'system', content: systemPrompt },\n { role: 'user', content: userPrompt }\n ],\n max_tokens: 30,\n temperature: 0.9,\n })\n\n return completion.choices[0]?.message?.content || `The ${context.objectName.toLowerCase()} bears witness to another secret.`\n } catch (error) {\n console.error('Error generating room interaction log:', error)\n return `The ${context.objectName.toLowerCase()} bears witness to another secret.`\n }\n}\n\nexport default openai"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create the OpenAI client utility and start implementing the AI-powered features: "},{"id":2,"type":2,"content":""},{"id":3,"type":3,"content":""}],"seen_state":"seen","structured_request_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":1,"tool_result_node":{"content":"Successfully edited the file app/game/[gameId]/room/page.tsx. IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "DEPLOYMENT.md", "file_content": "# \ud83d\ude80 Deploying Whispers to Vercel\n\n## Prerequisites\n- GitHub account with your repository\n- Vercel account (free tier works)\n- OpenAI API key\n- PostgreSQL database (we'll set this up)\n\n## Step 1: Set up Database\n\n### Option A: Vercel Postgres (Recommended)\n1. Go to [Vercel Dashboard](https://vercel.com/dashboard)\n2. Click \"Storage\" \u2192 \"Create Database\" \u2192 \"Postgres\"\n3. Choose a name like \"whispers-db\"\n4. Select your region\n5. Copy the connection string\n\n### Option B: Neon (Free PostgreSQL)\n1. Go to [Neon](https://neon.tech)\n2. Create a free account\n3. Create a new project\n4. Copy the connection string\n\n### Option C: Supabase (Free PostgreSQL)\n1. Go to [Supabase](https://supabase.com)\n2. Create a new project\n3. Go to Settings \u2192 Database\n4. Copy the connection string\n\n## Step 2: Deploy to Vercel\n\n### Method 1: Vercel Dashboard (Easiest)\n1. Go to [Vercel Dashboard](https://vercel.com/dashboard)\n2. Click \"New Project\"\n3. Import your GitHub repository: `prjwl16/the-traitors`\n4. Configure environment variables:\n - `DATABASE_URL`: Your PostgreSQL connection string\n - `OPENAI_API_KEY`: Your OpenAI API key\n5. Click \"Deploy\"\n\n### Method 2: Vercel CLI\n```bash\n# Install Vercel CLI\nnpm i -g vercel\n\n# Login to Vercel\nvercel login\n\n# Deploy\nvercel\n\n# Set environment variables\nvercel env add DATABASE_URL\nvercel env add OPENAI_API_KEY\n\n# Redeploy with environment variables\nvercel --prod\n```\n\n## Step 3: Set up Database Schema\n\nAfter deployment, you need to set up your database:\n\n1. In your Vercel project dashboard, go to \"Functions\"\n2. Find any API route and click \"View Function Logs\"\n3. Or use Vercel CLI:\n\n```bash\n# Generate Prisma client for production\nvercel env pull .env.local\nnpx prisma generate\nnpx prisma db push\n```\n\n## Step 4: Environment Variables\n\nMake sure these are set in Vercel:\n\n- `DATABASE_URL`: PostgreSQL connection string\n- `OPENAI_API_KEY`: Your OpenAI API key\n- `NEXTAUTH_URL`: Your Vercel domain (e.g., https://your-app.vercel.app)\n\n## Step 5: Test Your Deployment\n\n1. Visit your Vercel URL\n2. Create a new game\n3. Add players and start the game\n4. Test the Room of Secrets\n5. Verify AI features are working\n\n## Troubleshooting\n\n### Database Issues\n- Make sure your DATABASE_URL is correct\n- Check that the database allows connections from Vercel\n- Verify Prisma schema is pushed to the database\n\n### OpenAI Issues\n- Verify your OPENAI_API_KEY is valid\n- Check you have sufficient OpenAI credits\n- Monitor function logs for API errors\n\n### Build Issues\n- Check Vercel function logs\n- Ensure all dependencies are in package.json\n- Verify TypeScript compilation\n\n## Production Considerations\n\n1. **Database Backups**: Set up regular backups\n2. **Monitoring**: Use Vercel Analytics\n3. **Error Tracking**: Consider Sentry integration\n4. **Rate Limiting**: Implement for OpenAI API calls\n5. **Caching**: Add Redis for session management\n\n## Support\n\nIf you encounter issues:\n1. Check Vercel function logs\n2. Review this deployment guide\n3. Check the GitHub repository for updates"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create a deployment guide for you: ### **Step 4: Deployment Instructions** "},{"id":2,"type":2,"content":""},{"id":3,"type":3,"content":""}],"seen_state":"seen","structured_request_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":1,"tool_result_node":{"content":"Successfully edited the file prisma/schema.prisma. Here's your step-by-step deployment guide: ### ** Quick Deployment Steps:** #### **1. Set up Database (Choose One):** **Option A: Vercel Postgres (Easiest)** - Go to [Vercel Dashboard](https://vercel.com/dashboard) - Click "Storage" → "Create Database" → "Postgres" - Name it "whispers-db" - Copy the connection string **Option B: Neon (Free)** - Go to [Neon.tech](https://neon.tech) - Create free account → New project - Copy connection string #### **2. Deploy to Vercel:** 1. Go to [Vercel Dashboard](https://vercel.com/dashboard) 2. Click "New Project" 3. ","is_error":false,"request_id":"","tool_use_id":"toolu_vrtx_01NT1npgCU2YYrxajyBLZY1K"}},{"id":2,"type":4,"ide_state_node":{"workspaceFolders":[{"repositoryRoot":"/Users/prajwal/projects/traitors","folderRoot":"/Users/prajwal/projects/traitors"}],"workspaceFoldersUnchanged":false,"currentTerminal":{"terminalId":107,"currentWorkingDirectory":"/Users/prajwal/projects/traitors"}}}],"timestamp":"2025-06-28T03:16:25.736Z","response_text":"Based on my comprehensive analysis of the Whispers game codebase, here are the critical issues I've identified: ## **High-Risk Logic Bugs** ### **Vote Tie Handling** - **Issue**: Vote ties result in NO elimination (lines 57-61 in next-phase/route.ts) - **Risk**: Game can stall indefinitely with repeated ties - **Fix**: Implement tie-breaking (random, host decision, or revote) ### **Win Condition Race Condition** - **Issue**: Win conditions checked AFTER phase transition, not during elimination - **Risk**: Game continues when it should end, or ends at wrong time - **Fix**: Check win conditions immediately after elimination, before phase change ### **Auto-Phase vs Manual Phase Conflict** - **Issue**: Both auto-phase-check and manual next-phase can run simultaneously - **Risk**: Double elimination or inconsistent game state - **Fix**: Add mutex/locking mechanism ## ⚠️ **Unhandled Edge Cases** ### **Player Count Issues** ```typescript // Missing minimum player validation if (game.players.length < 3) { return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Need at least 3 players' }, { status: 400 }) } ``` ### **All Traitors Eliminated Early** - **Issue**: Game continues even when all traitors are dead - **Current**: Only checked after phase transitions - **Fix**: Check win conditions after every elimination ### **Empty Vote Scenarios** ```typescript // What if NO votes are cast? if (Object.keys(voteCount).length === 0) { // Currently: No elimination, but should this advance phase? } ``` ### **Dead Player Data Persistence** - **Issue**: Dead players still appear in voting UI dropdowns - **Frontend**: Filters alive players, but inconsistent across components - **Fix**: Consistent dead player filtering everywhere ## **Missing Input Validation** ### **API Endpoint Vulnerabilities** ```typescript // Missing in multiple endpoints: if (!gameId || !playerId) { return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Missing required IDs' }, { status: 400 }) } // Validate player belongs to game const player = game.players.find(p => p.id === playerId) if (!player) { return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Player not in game' }, { status: 403 }) } ``` ### **Role Assignment Edge Cases** ```typescript // What if playerCount = 1 or 2? const traitorCount = Math.max(1, Math.floor(playerCount / 3)) // With 2 players: 1 traitor, 1 faithful = traitors win immediately ``` ## **Frontend-Backend Inconsistencies** ### **Polling Race Conditions** - **Issue**: 3-second polling can miss rapid state changes - **Risk**: UI shows stale data during critical moments - **Fix**: WebSocket or server-sent events for real-time updates ### **LocalStorage Dependency** ```typescript // Fragile player identification const storedPlayerId = localStorage.getItem('playerId') if (!storedPlayerId) { router.push('/') // Kicks player out of active game } ``` ### **Vote Display Inconsistency** - **Backend**: Counts all votes for current phase/day - **Frontend**: May show cached vote counts during transitions ## ️ **Defensive Programming Suggestions** ### **1. Add Comprehensive Validation** ```typescript // In every game endpoint: const validateGameAccess = async (gameId: string, playerId: string) => { const game = await prisma.game.findUnique({ where: { id: gameId }, include: { players: true } }) if (!game) throw new Error('Game not found') const player = game.players.find(p => p.id === playerId) if (!player) throw new Error('Player not in game') if (!player.isAlive) throw new Error('Dead players cannot perform this action') return { game, player } } ``` ### **2. Implement Proper Tie-Breaking** ```typescript // In vote counting logic: if (playersWithMaxVotes.length > 1) { // Option 1: Random selection eliminatedPlayerId = playersWithMaxVotes[Math.floor(Math.random() * playersWithMaxVotes.length)] // Option 2: Host decides // Store tie for host resolution // Option 3: No elimination on ties // eliminatedPlayerId = null (current behavior) } ``` ### **3. Add Win Condition Checks Everywhere** ```typescript const checkWinConditions = (alivePlayers: Player[]) => { const aliveTraitors = alivePlayers.filter(p => p.role === 'TRAITOR').length const aliveFaithfuls = alivePlayers.filter(p => p.role === 'FAITHFUL').length if (aliveTraitors === 0) return { ended: true, winner: 'FAITHFULS' } if (aliveTraitors >= aliveFaithfuls) return { ended: true, winner: 'TRAITORS' } return { ended: false, winner: null } } ``` ### **4. Add Game State Locking** ```typescript // Prevent concurrent phase changes const gameStateLock = new Map() const acquireLock = (gameId: string) => { if (gameStateLock.get(gameId)) { throw new Error('Game state is being updated') } gameStateLock.set(gameId, true) } ``` ### **5. Improve Error Boundaries** ```typescript // In frontend components: const [gameState, setGameState] = useState<'loading' | 'error' | 'ready'>('loading') // Handle all possible game states gracefully if (gameState === 'error') { return } ``` ## **Priority Fixes** 1. **Critical**: Fix vote tie handling 2. **Critical**: Add win condition checks after eliminations 3. **High**: Implement game state locking 4. **High**: Add comprehensive input validation 5. **Medium**: Improve frontend error handling 6. **Medium**: Add minimum player count validation These fixes will make your game much more robust and prevent the most common game-breaking scenarios!
